Sentencas: Hydrocarbon fueled cell reactions, which consist of thermal decomposition, reforming, and CO shift reactions, and electrochemical oxidation in the Ni - ScSZ anode of solid oxide fuel cells, were examined by electrochemical measurements and outlet gas analysis for several hydrocarbon fuels (CH4, C3H8, C8H18, C12H26).
Titulo: Reaction process in the Ni-ScSZ anode for hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: Examinations on the anode potential and its relation to observed outlet gas compositions have revealed that hydrogen molecules were mainly electrochemically oxidized even for hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Reaction process in the Ni-ScSZ anode for hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: The electrode conductivities can be well correlated with the water vapor partial pressure for both hydrogen and hydrocarbons.
Titulo: Reaction process in the Ni-ScSZ anode for hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: Water vapor produced as a result of the electrochemical oxidation of hydrogen promotes the hydrogen-producing reactions in the vicinity of the electrochemically active site.
Titulo: Reaction process in the Ni-ScSZ anode for hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: A large difference in the thermal decomposition of hydrocarbons appeared in the anode potential and also in the maximum fuel utilization between methane and other hydrocarbons.
Titulo: Reaction process in the Ni-ScSZ anode for hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: A simple reaction model has been proposed to interpret consistently the electrode reactions as well as the reforming and the CO shift reactions with a focus on the oxygen atoms on Ni surfaces as a catalyst for both the electrode and the reforming reactions.
Titulo: Reaction process in the Ni-ScSZ anode for hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs
Reaction process in the Ni-ScSZ anode for hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs
